name: NBN fast advance test
description: The first NBN deck I built that I actually like.

name: NBN Psychotag
description: Stack credits. Midseason them. Psychographics a Beale for the game win.

name: Noise Job (13th place Portland regional)
description: The runner deck that I took to the Portland Regional. You can view the entire tournament report on here: http://www.projectmulligan.com/android-netrunner-portland-regional-after-action-report/

name: En Passant (Overmind + Street Chess)
description:
Cassia programs like Deep Red. Deep Red has memory. Overmind likes memory. Ergo...this.

The deck uses the "Street Chess" combo, which consists of: 1) Play a Pawn, 2) Use Deep Red's ability to install it, 3) Run successfully, 4) Sacrifice the Pawn to install one from your heap onto Scheherazade, and 5) Collect 1 credit and draw 1 card.

However, since Deep Red has so much memory going for it already, Overmind seemed a natural choice for a companion icebreaker, especially since Test Run and Salvage can reset the counters on it.

The Femme Fatale is your answer to any ice a Knight or an Overmind can't deal with, and the Net Shield and Plascretes are your defense versus net and meat damage, respectively.

Early game, your two priorities are getting a Deep Red into play and a Pawn into your heap. From there, just keep applying pressure with runs (and using e3 Feedback Implants to make your Knights and Overminds even more efficient) until you're able to start Indexing R&D to pick out those Agendas.

This deck has yet to be thoroughly tested, so any and all advice is welcome. :)

name: Making Very Fast News
description: I recently got the alt art NbN, so I have to make a deck that uses it :) Straightforward Fast Advance. Event based economy and SanSan/Astroscript so that agendas do not see the table. Ideas are welcome :)

name: Dreamwalker
description: Sleep your way to victory and hack the corp's server from the cheapest hardware you can find. A console? Bah! Why bother when a Prepaid Voicepad is enough?

name: Mushin YOUR FACE!
description: Some kind of supermodernism with an economy fueled with GRNDL Refinery + Mushin No Shin. I feel it's not viable yet, but it should be fun anyway.

name: Chaos G.O.D.  v.1.2
description:
Grappling Hook + Overmind + Deep Red.

Overmind benefits from the +3 MU of Deep Red and Chaos Theory's own +1 MU. Grappling Hook to take care of the bigger and expensive ice, with e3 Feedback Implants helping break all the subroutines, or helping save some power tokens from Overmind.

Test Run / Scavenge / Clone Chip to fetch and recycle.

There are two main issues with Overmind, that come to mind: 1) Swordsman 2) Wraparound

Being an AI Icebreaker, Overmind cannot break Swordsman, so the solution would be to "waste" a Grappling Hook breaking it, which unfortunately can become troublesome after a while. If it becomes a more pressing issue, it could be solved splashing a single Mimic or even using any other Killer in single copy.

Wraparound can be broken, but with no Fracter it gets really expensive. Ice Wall too, if advanced a lot, could pose the same problem. Femme Fatale could solve both issues, but Knight can manage Wraparound as well anyway, and Ice Wall get rarely advanced so much as to become a real problem. One could always add a single Inti just to take care of Wraparound, anyway.

Deus Ex is here just for Jinteki, given how much it will be played with the newly released Deluxe.

Not much else to say, the deck works perfectly fine even with a single Overmind (eventually reinstalled with Scavenge) and e3 Feedback Implants, most of the time. The economy should be fine, especially given the overall low cost of the cards involved. Hardly had a problem with it, so far.

name: Stirling Reputation
description: I am a pretty big fan of this deck. Gonna playtest and tighten it up. It makes absurd amounts of money.

name: Alpha - Omega - Track me and bad money
description:
Many cards with link for the 3 3underwolrd contact" The link is also an axe of my deck. It's a powerfull anti track (4 or 5 link is perfect in the game.) Combo Test Run and Scavenge. Also Self-modifuing Code for search IceBreaker. Only Three Icibreaker in the deck but with one anti sentry and anti swordman. Because the 2 other are AI ice breaker. Personal Touch and Omni-Drive and Cloack for a better economy.

Actually no tested in game. But what do you think of this deck ?

name: Alexfrog's Corp Cube (180 cards / special rules)
description:
Standard (4-6 player) Draft four sets of 10 cards each! Or Grid (3x3) draft 12 sets of 9 (2 player).

IMPORTANT: The 3 point agendas arent in the cube!!
They only exist in order to allow netrunnerdb to publish the deck, by making it a 'legal' deck in terms of influence points. (I couldnt even make it fit with only 5/3s. 5 was too few and 6 too many, omg! Remove that dumb restriction!

CORP Basic cards:
(The Shadow) 7 Sentinel Defense Program 2 Pad Campaign 1 Fenris

RUNNER Basic cards: (The Masque) 1 Snowball 1 Peacock 2 Armitage Codebusting

No fast advance cards, minimal 3/2 agendas, no 5/3 agendas, no Siphon, Desperado, Parasite, Shutdown, etc.

name: Alexfrog's Runner Cube (180 cards / special rules)
description:
Standard (4-6 player) draft four packs of 10 cards each! OR Grid draft (3x3) 12 sets of 9 cards. (2 player)

RUNNER basic cards: Basic cards: 1 Snowball 1 Peacock 2 Armitage Codebusting

CORP Basic cards:
(The Shadow) 7 Sentinel Defense Program 2 Pad Campaign 1 Fenris

No fast advance cards, minimal 3/2 agendas, no 5/3 agendas, no Siphon, Desperado, Parasite, Shutdown, etc.

name: Ken Tenma Control Deck
description: Criminal deck inspired by the Shaper Control builds using PPVP. Working fairly well but not sure if it is any better than the prototypical Gabe and Andy decks already out there.

name: Glacier Raven
description: HB Glacier Deck with Closed Accounts and Data Raven to punish Tag-Me Criminal and to help with the Shaper match up.

name: CT Overmind
description: The plan is to get Overmind out with lots of counters and break cheaply due to e3. Inti and Pipeline is there because of Wraparound and Swordsman. Clone Chip, Test Run and Scavenge to get get Overmind back when it runs out in an emergency one of the other breakers. Replicator to thin out the deck and get the hardware out faster.

name: One Point to Rule Them All
description: My take on an Iceless Jinteki Shell Game. With 19 agendas in the deck you can IAA on any given turn. If the Runner runs it, they'll take the net damage from PE, if they don't, they'll take the net damage when I decide to score it. If the runner is too spooked by ambushes to run, you can set up a chain of scores that might be enough to flatline them outright. No proof that this will ever work, but I feel like it'll be fun to try.
